alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 4:35PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marion County through 500 PM CST... At 435 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Tremont, or 11 miles northwest of Hamilton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pigeye and Shottsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northwestern Alabama.
